desc.p: Description of the type of Collateral
VALIDATION RULES
Up to 35 characters free text. Multi-language field. (Mandatory input) Defaults from the main collateral type record.
Execution value as a percentage of Nominal Value but different from that in the main Collateral Type record.
Example.
COLLATERAL.TYPE-100-cash collaterals-EXECUTION.VALUE-100%N
CUSTOMER.COLLATERAL.TYPE-100053-100-EXECUTION.VALUE-75%N.
In the above case Execution Value for the collaterals under Collateral Type 100 for the customer 100053 will be calculated at 75%N only.
Mandatory input; Allowed as %N only, in the range 0-100. (E.g.50%N, 60%N Etc.)
Duplication of the percentage in the main record not allowed.
Unique identification of customer collateral type. The format is a valid customer number followed by a valid collateral type separated by a hyphen.
Example:
COLLATERAL.TYPE: ID=100
NOMINAL. VALUE=F
EXECUTION.VALUE=100%N
When collaterals are created under this collateral type, the execution value will be calculated at100% of the nominal value for all customers.

If the user desires to fix the execution value differently @ 50%N, for the collaterals under this collateral type to a particular customer say 100053, then this table can be used. The ID of the CUSTOMER.COLLATERAL.TYPE record will be 100053-100, in which user can input the desired percentage in the field EXECUTION.VALUE.
Valid Customer Number followed by a valid Collateral Type separated by a hyphen.
Input allowed only if the EXECUTION.VALUE in main COLLATERAL.TYPE is %N.
This is a multi valued field. Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
This is a multi valued field.
Contains details of any override applicable to this record.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered. This is a NOINPUT field.
